SUB_W07_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_00.text:
This world looks normal enough.
Also, pretty sure I'm detecting
a faint presence of spirits here.

SUB_W07_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_WRLD_MIDO_INITIAL_000_CUT_000_01.text:
As for where to go first...
Guess I should just do the usual.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Looks like there used to be some sort
of altar here. Yeesh, somebody went
and smashed the place up good.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text: You one of the locals, maybe?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Huh. Guess you don't speak my language—
and golly, why would you? Sure seems like
you're trying to tell me something, though.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text: We've a visitor at the Soul Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
A Flamewave League spy, perhaps?
I've not seen his like before.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
As if we would recruit so
ostentatious an agent!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
The Soul Temple has been the site of strange
phenomena since ancient times. Is that not
why we banded together to destroy it?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Are you suggesting this creature is
a Soul Voyager? Are we to be ruled
by the Soul Temple even now?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
If he is indeed a Soul Voyager,
we of the Flamewave League
will not engage with him.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
And nor will we of the
Forestgale Alliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text:
Well, isn't that something? Sounds like
I'm on the outs with all these folks.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SOULCULTIST_000_CUT_00.text: Hm? When'd you get back? ...How's that? You'll guide me around this world? Heck, I'm glad someone is willing to give me the time of day.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Didn't sound like those folks had much
interest in talkin' to me, so not
really sure why you lead me here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Be welcome at the Flame Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
...Or they changed their minds, maybe?
Well, hey there, bud. Mind telling a guy
what's up with this 'Soul Voyager' deal?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
The Four Tribes of Cinq once had our lives
controlled by the Soul Temple. Eventually
we grew to despise its dominion over us,
and so banded together to destroy it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
In the days when we were still under its sway,
travelers would occasionally appear. We named
them Soul Voyagers, for whatever they sought
would greatly affect the lives of all in Cinq.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
We know well the power of a Soul Voyager,
and humbly request your assistance in
defeating the Forestgale Alliance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text: Now hold on just a minute there. You're at war with each other?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Flamewave League and the Forestgale Alliance. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Flamewave League!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Sure, guy. Lemme noodle on that
there for a bit.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Take whatever time you need.
We await your favorable reply.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Well, look who's still lurking around.
You got a take on all this, bud?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Don't think it really matters which one
I pick, eh? Yeah, I figured the same. Most likely I'll get spirit power no matter
who I help out. Meaning, likewise, I won't
get any spirit power unless I make up my
mind and choose a team.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.text:
Hey there. You Flame Temple
fellas looking to get my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_010_C.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Flamewave League do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLE_INTRO_010_CUT_0.text:
What do you think, fella?
Should we go with this one?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
Thank you, Soul Voyager.
Now then, if I may be so bold as to
ask, we would appreciate your help.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_INTRO_000_C.text:
No worries, fella. Ask away
and I'll see what I can do.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text:
Be welcome at the Wave Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Waveflame League and the Forestgale Alliance. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_000_.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Waveflame League!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.text:
Hey there. You Wave Temple
fellas looking to get my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_INTRO_010_.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Waveflame League do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
Be welcome at the Gale Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
We know well the power of a Soul Voyager,
and humbly request your assistance in
defeating the Flamewave League.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Galeforest Alliance and the Flamewave League. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_000_C.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Galeforest Alliance!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.text:
Hey there. You Gale Temple
fellas looking to get my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_INTRO_010_C.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Galeforest Alliance do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text:
Be welcome at the Forest Temple,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text: After the Soul Temple's destruction, the tribes of Cinq divided into two factions: the Forestgale Alliance and the Flamewave League. And while this conflict has not led to violence as yet, we remain in a state of perpetual opposition. This is why we must win.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_000_.text:
So please, Soul Voyager! Grant your
sacred aid to the Forestgale Alliance!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.text:
Hey there. You Forest Temple
fellas looking to get my help?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_INTRO_010_.text:
Ah, so you understand the situation already.
Yes, we of the Forestgale Alliance do indeed
seek your aid, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We must boost our economic strength
if we hope to win this war. To this end,
we are creating factories one after another,
putting a strain on our energy supply.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
As our League has heat sources and water
in abundance, we use steam as our primary
means of generating power.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sounds like a solid plan to me.
What's the problem?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The output of our steam plant is dropping.
Should the Soul Voyager stop by, I am sure
both the problem and its solution will be
made apparent.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I dunno about that, guy.
But sure, I'll give it a shot.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_000_00.text:
Yikes, would you look at this?
We got clean energy produced
by water and geothermal heat!
Sure is something, all right.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_000_02.speaker: Nitram

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_000_03.text: So what do I do here, exactly?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_010_00.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_010_00.text:
I expected no less from you, Voyager!
Those fiends are sent by the Forestgale
Alliance, and perpetually cause damage
in this place. But today, the plant remains unharmed!
Sadly for the beasts, they cannot say the same.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_141_CUT_010_01.text:
I do not expect the Forestgale Alliance
to launch another attack any time soon,
so thank you again for your efforts.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
With the issue at the steam plant resolved,
our factories can now operate at full capacity.
However, we've realized our transportation
infrastructure cannot handle the output.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We need more harbors and ships. Furthermore,
our current lack of shipyards will surely lead
to additional problems down the road.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: And you think I can help, maybe?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'd like to ask you to visit a shipyard
construction site, where I feel certain
your presence will cause something
quite beneficial to transpire.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Not much of an explanation there, guy.
But sure, I'll see what I can do.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_00.text:
So this is where they're building
a new shipyard, eh?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_02.text:
Welcome, Voyager! Your arrival will
surely hasten the construction of
this important site!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_03.text:
Don't really see how that's
supposed to work, actually.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_04.text:
I mean, everybody's already workin'
real hard, so maybe just having me
watch 'em will be good enough?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_05.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_05.text:
Hey, there you are, bud!
...Huh? You want me to come that way?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_06.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_06.text:
Hm? Looks like somebody
misplaced a box over here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_07.text:
Sweet heck, it's a bomb!
Get outta here, you!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_08.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_08.text:
Are you all right, Voyager!?
I heard an explosion!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_09.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_09.text:
Still got all my fingers and toes
if that's what you mean.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_10.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_10.text:
This is clearly the work of the Forestgale
Alliance—one of their spies must have
infiltrated the site. I will begin a
thorough investigation at once!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_11.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_11.text:
How did you locate that bomb,
if you don't mind my asking?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_13.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_000_13.text:
Well, regardless, your being here
was clearly a blessing. Thank you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_010_00.text:
Thanks a lot there, fella.
Everyone was saved because of you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_010_01.text:
If you keep getting in our way, Voyager,
I'm afraid I'll have to get rid of you.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_142_CUT_010_02.text:
So I help one side and the other
turns against me? This is getting
to be more trouble than it's worth.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'm given to understand that you foiled the
enemy's attempt to sabotage our new shipyard.
You Soul Voyagers truly are special beings!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Construction of the shipyard is now complete,
offering a solution to our long-term shipping
problems. However, we would like to bring our
war with the Forestgale Alliance to a swifter end.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: All right. What's the plan?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The backbone of the Forestgale Alliance's
economy is their system of railways.
Something must be done about it.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Something like...sabotage? 'Cause, fella,
I'm not interested in busting up a
bunch of innocent trains.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
All we ask is that you visit a train
station of the Forestgale Alliance.
The rest will take care of itself.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_00.text:
Heck, these Forestgale trains sure are swell.
They carry passengers and cargo and all
kinds of stuff!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_01.text:
Ah, the Soul Voyager!
What are you doing here?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_02.text:
Heard you had a real nice train line,
so I came to see it for myself—and it's
even more of a humdinger than I thought!
Sure am glad I got to check it out.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_03.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_03.text:
While I'm pleased to see you enjoying our train
system, I somehow expect you've not come
simply for sightseeing. As such, we will take
the liberty of escorting you during your visit.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_04.text:
A guided tour?
Boy, that's even better! Hey, so I feel like I've met that
fella there before. Or am I mixing
him up with someone else, maybe?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_06.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_06.text:
I trust you've seen enough?
Perhaps it's time you departed.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_07.text:
I hear you, guy—it's always rude to overstay
a welcome. Thanks a bunch for showing me
around the place, though.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_08.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_08.text:
Where the Voyager travels, calamity follows.
I am relieved to see that this instance
proved to be the exception to the—

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_10.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_10.text:
And we were too distracted with the Voyager
to see it coming! Damn you, Voyager!
You have brought ruin upon us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_11.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_11.text:
It's almost like they turned me into an
accomplice for their sabotage mission.
What do you think, fella? This on me?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_12.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_143_CUT_000_12.text:
...Not my fault, then? Phew!
That sure is a load off my mind.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our verdant forests supply the Alliance
with an ample amount of lumber.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sadly, we have fallen far behind in
the task of processing said lumber;
we simply cannot afford to maintain
the necessary workforce.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Ever thought about mechanizing
the process, maybe?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed we have, which is why the Gale and Forest
Tribes have begun working together to construct
a mill. However, the project is beset with issues
that I am hoping you might resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The peoples of Gale and Forest have begun
working together to construct a lumber mill.
However, the project is beset with issues
that I am hoping you might resolve.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: I'll do what I can, fella.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_00.text:
This must be where they're building the
lumber mill. Sure as heck doesn't look
like they've made much progress, though.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_02.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_02.text:
I am pleased to see you come, Voyager. Alas,
those of the Gale Tribe who are supposed to
be helping us construct the mill refuse to work. Might I ask you to scold them in my stead?
While they ignore me, they'll not so easily
shrug off a rebuke from a Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_03.text:
Yeah, no, I'm not just gonna start chewing out
some poor people I've never met. But how about
I head over to these Gale folks and hear their
side of the story?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_04.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_04.text:
The work is just too dangerous! These woods
are filled with all manner of horrid beasts,
and they're perpetually waiting for a chance
to make us their dinner! We tried telling the Forest Tribe that you can't
build a mill when you're always looking over
your shoulder, but they don't seem to care!
I simply don't understand their kind...

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_05.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_05.text:
Okay, bud, I gotcha.
Lemme look into this, okay?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_06.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_06.text: Yipes! We got a beast right here!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_07.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_07.text:
To the Forest Tribe, beasts of the wood are
treasured neighbors with whom we coexist. And while we do eat them at times, our hunting
season is primarily for population control.
We cannot simply slaughter them indiscriminately
to ease the nerves of some cowardly wind people!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_08.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_08.text:
Hey, I like conservation as much as the
next guy, but the thing I saw in the forest 
was a fiend—not a beast.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_09.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_09.text: Hmm. We have sensed a disturbing decline in the beasts' numbers of late, so perhaps this is the reason. Which means... Of course! Those villains from the Flamewave League must be releasing fiends into our woods! Might I ask you to cull the numbers of these interlopers, Voyager?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_10.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_000_10.text:
Yeah, I guess I oughta help
critters out whenever I can.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_010_00.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_010_00.text:
Now the Gale Tribe
can work without fear.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_231_CUT_010_01.text:
I can't believe the Flamewave League was behind
those monsters! They very nearly managed to
cause strife between us and the Forest Tribe,
and they will pay dearly for it!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Thanks to the new mill, we'll be able to
finish some large-scale construction
projects that were on hold.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our next project is installing wind turbines in the
Gale Tribe's residential district. If we complete
that, the Alliance's energy production will finally
be comparable to that of the League.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: And I fit in how?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Oh, I appreciate someone who doesn't beat
around the bush! The crux of it is this: we expect
the League to attempt to sabotage the project,
for there's no low their kind won't sink to.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our next project is installing wind turbines
in the Gale Tribe's residential district.
But we expect the League to attempt sabotage,
for there's no low their kind won't sink to.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Probably send more of those fiends
to try and muck up the works, eh?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_00.text:
Whoa, look at this construction site.
Guess it isn't easy to turn wind into
electricity, huh?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_01.text:
Yes, and the greater the project,
the harder it is to defend. We've already had a rash of suspicious fires
that destroyed precious materials recently
delivered from the mill. Without a doubt,
this is the work of the Flamewave League.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_02.text:
Sounds like you need a watchman.
No problem, guy.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_05.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_05.text:
Heck, I'm exhausted—playing whack-a-mole
with arsonists all night gets old fast.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_06.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_06.text:
Thanks to you, our materials are safe,
and construction is proceeding smoothly.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_07.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_07.text:
Let's just hope those arsonists
get the hint and give up soon.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_09.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_09.text: Fiend! A giant fiend is coming!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_10.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_000_10.text:
Looks like they're playing for keeps.
Good thing I can play that way, too!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_010_00.text:
Think I'm finally ready to hang up
my guard boots for good.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_010_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_232_CUT_010_01.text:
What's that? You praising me, fella?
Well, ain't that just swell.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Various industries have been reaping the
benefit of the Alliance's new wind energy,
and our economic prospects seem bright.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sadly, while we strive to live in greater
harmony with nature than the Flamewave League,
this has put us at a disadvantage in the war.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Even with our recent gains,
our loss is inevitable.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You sure about that, fella?
Can't you do something?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our only option would be to attack the enemy's
infrastructure. If we can destroy their port,
we will deal a great blow to their economy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Can't say I like the sound of helping
with something like that.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_00.text:
Something about this whole deal
just doesn't sit right with me.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_02.text:
You have come, Voyager—
just as our intelligence predicted.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_03.text:
We know you are planning to destroy the port,
and I will not allow it! Your meddling will cause
no harm to the League today!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_04.text:
Intelligence, eh? Sounds like I was just
the decoy and they'd been planning to
do this job all along...

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_05.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_233_CUT_000_05.text:
Cease your mumbling! Now then, tell me who sent you and
why you have come. I need to hear
a confession from your own lips.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Our long war is finally over!
The Flamewave League stands victorious!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Our League has proven its dominance
thanks to the Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Should your travels bring you to this
world again, please do visit our temple.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
Boy howdy, they sure chased me outta there
in a hurry—guess they've decided the work
of the Soul Voyager is done? Can't say this feels over to me,
but hey, what do I know? For now,
I guess I'll go find some spirits.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
You know if there are any
spirits around here, pal?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text:
What's that, fella? You telling me
it's still too early for that?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_FWWIN_000_.text: Guess I'll play the Voyager a bit longer.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Our long war is finally over!
The Forestgale Alliance stands victorious!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Our Alliance has proven its dominance
thanks to the Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Should your travels bring you to this
world again, please do visit our temple.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Guess I shouldn't be surprised they're tossing
me out on my ear—this whole 'Soul Voyager'
nonsense was just a way for them to win the war. ...Eh, probably for the best.
I've got things to do, anyway.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
You know if there are any
spirits around here, pal?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_SWITCHPHASE_WWWIN_000_.text:
Guess I got no choice but to play
the Voyager a while longer.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
I know I should feel good about everything
that happened here since it ended a war
and all, but...yeah. I don't.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
You have come at an opportune time,
Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Wave Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Well, heck. I thought the way you folks 
all came together was pretty swell.
Why'd your League fall apart?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Wave Temple sees things differently,
and has decreed our people can never be one.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Take whatever time you need.
We await your favorable reply.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
You know, I seem to remember something pretty
dang similar happening here not so long ago.
What do you think, fella?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Don't give a shoot one way or the other?
Yeah, you never really cared about this—
and frankly, neither do I. This whole mess is just gonna keep going
until one of 'em finally wins, which feels
pretty pointless to me.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.text:
The Flame Temple feels the same?
Oh, you gotta be kiddin' me...

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEFIRE_BETRAYAL_01.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Wave Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Flame Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Well, heck. I thought the way you folks 
all came together was pretty swell.
Why'd your League fall apart?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Flame Temple sees things differently,
and has decreed our people can never be one.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
The Wave Temple feels the same?
Oh, you gotta be kiddin' me...

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWATER_BETRAYAL_0.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Flame Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Forest Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
Well, heck. I thought the way you folks 
all came together was pretty swell.
Why'd your Alliance fall apart?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_00.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Forest Temple sees things differently,
and claims the forest has no need of wind.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.text:
The Gale Temple feels the same?
Oh, you gotta be kiddin' me...

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWIND_BETRAYAL_01.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Forest Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Wrong, you say? Yes, we have been feeling much
the same—in fact, we now suspect the Gale Tribe
intends to attack us! Therefore, we must make a
proactive move, lest we yield the initiative.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
Well, heck. I thought the way you folks 
all came together was pretty swell.
Why'd your Alliance fall apart?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
As much as I wish it could have continued,
the Gale Temple sees things differently,
and declared the woods an obstacle to wind.
Knowing this, I ask you to aid us!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
The Forest Temple feels the same?
Oh, you gotta be kiddin' me...

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_TEMPLEWOODS_BETRAYAL_0.text:
We are resolved to launch an attack
on the Gale Tribe, Voyager, and would
much appreciate your aid.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We were able to claim victory in our war
against the Forestgale Alliance due to our
superior energy production.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You folks gonna build another
steam plant, then?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No. That would take far too long, causing
us to fall behind in the war against the
wave people. Instead, we seek to upgrade
our current plant.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sounds like you need an engineer
there, guy. Which, uh, isn't me.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I ask only that you visit the plant.
That should ensure all goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Y'know, you leave a lot of important information out of your requests.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_00.text:
Hey, the energy from this plant also goes
to the Wave Tribe, right? So why can't
you folks all cooperate for this?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_01.text:
Because their incessant harassment
has completely stalled our plans
to upgrade the power plant!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_03.text:
They loose fiends near the cooling pools,
which both endangers our staff and reduces
the plant's efficiency.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_000_04.text:
Now there's something we can help with.
Consider the fiends wrangled, guy.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_010_00.text:
You flame folks have trouble with fiends like
these? They were nothing to write home
about, which makes me wonder if the Wave
Tribe's all that serious about taking you out.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_101_CUT_010_01.text:
While you have my gratitude, Voyager,
you know little of the Wave Tribe.
They are indeed set on annihilating
our kind!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We wish to make use of various minerals
which can be obtained from volcanoes.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Gonna toss 'em in and melt 'em?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: You are rather ignorant about our technology, Voyager. We are only securing the minerals from the volcano; we will later smelt them using the heat from our steam plant.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Which is a lot more powerful now
thanks to the upgrade.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Precisely so. We will use that energy to power
our forges, which will allow us to make ever
more potent weapons and lead us to victory!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We will use that energy to power our forges,
which will allow us to make ever more potent
weapons and lead us to a great victory!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sure there isn't something you wanna
make besides weapons there, guy?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_000_01.text:
What you are feeling is the heat from the
volcano mingling with our fiery enthusiasm
for these ironworks.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_000_02.text:
Whatever it is, I got no interest in
hanging around longer than I have to.
So let's get to it: what's the problem?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_000_03.text:
The fire fiends here don't like our presence.
And while we're not afraid of their attacks,
per se, we also haven't figured out an
effective strategy to combat them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_010_00.text: The heat was just the worst, but I managed to take care of things.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_102_CUT_010_01.text:
Thank you! Now we can finish the
ironworks without further incident.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We have arrived at a decision, Voyager:
we are going to destroy the shipyard
that once stood as a proud symbol
of the Flamewave League's unity.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Now hold on, guy. What's the point
in going around destroyin' stuff?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The psychological damage it will deal
to the Wave Tribe is the best way to
ensure a rapid victory against them.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Well, I'm sure as shoot not gonna
help you destroy a place I once
saved from being blown up!

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We will win this war with or without
your assistance, Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_000_00.text:
Are these folks really gonna
blow up the dang shipyard?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_000_01.text:
I understand how you must feel, Voyager,
seeing as you once risked your life in defense
of the shipyard. But there is no other choice
left to us.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_000_02.text:
Heck, bud—YOU were the one who really
saved this place. I bet you're feelin'
pretty low now, huh?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_010_00.text:
Boy howdy, this is bumming me out.
How did it all come to this?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_010_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_103_CUT_010_01.text:
Welp, at least it's all over now.
Time for me to find some spirits
and get the heck outta here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
We have destroyed all the enemy
temples thanks to your good work.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
Guy, I'm just passing through.
I never saw any of the people
here as my enemy.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
No, of course not. Regardless, now that only
the Flame Temple remains, we can finally
cover the entirety of Cinq with magma.
Then only we will remain!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: FirePriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You have served us well, Soul Voyager,
and I wish to grant you tribute.
What is it you desire?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.speaker: UI
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_100_CUT_000_0.text:
You have already acquired
a fire spirit's power.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our transportation infrastructure gives us an
advantage over the Flame Tribe, for we can move
more on our waterways than on any land route—
so long as we have the ships, that is.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You folks gonna build another
shipyard, then?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No. That would take far too long, causing
us to fall behind in the war against the
Flame Tribe. Instead, we seek to upgrade
our current one.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sounds like you need an engineer
there, guy. Which, uh, isn't me.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I ask only that you visit the shipyard.
That should ensure all goes smoothly.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Y'know, you leave a lot of important information out of your requests.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_00.text:
Remember how you saved this place, guy?
That was some good work right there.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_01.text:
All right then. How do we go about
upgrading this puppy?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_02.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_02.text:
While our shipyard is capable of producing
large-scale vessels, its facilities are
lacking due to its hasty construction
in the midst of the war. And since building large vessels is an
inefficient process at the best of times,
we must see this situation rectified.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_03.text:
You're looking to upgrade this place so you
can build large ships more efficiently?
Sorry, fella, but that kind of thing
is way out of my comfort zone.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_04.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_000_04.text: Ha ha! We certainly do not expect your help with that, Voyager. We have specialists in that field arriving any min—

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_010_00.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_010_00.text:
You truly have a knack for being where
you are needed most, Voyager.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_010_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_401_CUT_010_01.text:
Pretty sure that's because all you do
is lead me straight into trouble, fella.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our waterways are now so crowded that
we fear the possibility of a collision.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sounds like a real problem, all right.
What are you going to do about it?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to construct a lighthouse
and highlight safe shipping routes.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Heck of a plan there, bud—lighthouses
are the best! Mind if I come take a peek
once you've got the thing up and running?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Actually, I would prefer
that you go see it now.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would like you to visit the
lighthouse construction site.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Just in case something happens, eh?
Yeah, I know how this goes.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_00.text:
So this is where they're building the
lighthouse, eh? Wish I could've waited
until the thing was done; nobody gives
two hoots about an unfinished lighthouse.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_01.text:
Yet had you waited, there would be no
lighthouse to see, for fiends are currently
preventing us from building it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_02.text:
Lemme guess: these fiends were
sent here by the Flame Tribe?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_03.text:
No, in fact—these appear to be native
creatures who simply don't appreciate
what we're doing in their territory.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_000_04.text: Oh. Well, guess that's my cue.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_010_00.text:
So how much fighting do
I gotta do here, fella?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_010_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_010_01.text:
The fiends should calm down once
construction is finished and we
vacate the area.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_402_CUT_010_02.text:
Well, geez. Sounds like that's not
happening anytime soon.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We have arrived at a decision, Voyager:
we are going to destroy the steam plant
that once stood as a proud symbol of
the Waveflame League's unity.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Uh, but won't that cause problems
for your folks too?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, but it is still the best way to ensure
a rapid victory against the Flame Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Where I'm from, fella, we try not to
toss the baby out with the bathwater.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: No one asked for your opinion.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_00.text:
So how are you planning
to stop this thing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_01.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_01.text:
If the pressure of the steam exceeds
a certain level, the plant will explode.
Accidents do happen, after all.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_02.text:
Except this is one 'accident'
the Wave Temple knows
about in advance.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_03.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_03.text:
Everyone knows about the potential for
accidents. If this one causes excessive
damage, it will be on the Flame Tribe for
not taking proper precautions.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_403_CUT_000_04.text:
You can't rationalize away an
accident YOU'RE causing!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text:
As the Wave Tribe cannot survive for long in
the open air, we have no intentions of stealing
the lands of others. All we desire is for all to
live in peace within their own territories.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text: So why'd you wage war, then?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: WaterPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text: Because they looked to conquer us! No, the peace we sought could only be secured through the destruction of all other temples.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.speaker: UI
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_400_CUT_000_0.text:
You have already acquired
a water spirit's power.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We must increase our energy capacity without
attracting attention from the Forest Tribe.
To this end, we seek to upgrade our output
of wind energy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
So you're masking upgrades
as routine maintenance?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, exactly so! Ah, but it is a relief
to have your keen insight on our side,
Soul Voyager.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
And you're not worried the forest folks
will have the same insight, maybe?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Indeed I am. In fact, the Forest Tribe are
certain to come investigate our dealings,
and I am at a loss for how to deter them.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Might I ask you to visit the wind farm?
I have no desire to risk trouble between
our peoples at this point.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Hey, I'm happy to wander over and
make sure no fights break out.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_00.text:
Gosh, looks like a bunch of forest folks
are sightseeing at the plant. Er, or is this
actually a covert surveillance deal?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_01.text:
It will be impossible to replace the
components necessary to boost our output
with so many people watching, Voyager.
What is to be done?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_02.text:
Well, I suppose you could unleash
a fiend around here.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_03.text:
An interesting thought... Yet while the
Forest Tribe would certainly pay us little
mind during a fiend attack, it would also
place our workers in grave danger.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_000_04.text:
Oh, we've got that part handled, guy.
Your folks'll be safe and sound.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_010_00.text: Hey! I asked for a fiend, not a dang herd!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_301_CUT_010_01.text:
We may have gotten carried away a bit,
and for this, I apologize. But surely
they were no more than a minor
inconvenience for you, Voyager?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
As there has been no change to the Forest
Tribe's supply of energy, they currently
suspect nothing. We must use this chance
to strengthen our own position.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: You gonna build weapons, maybe?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We intend to take measures such as increasing
food production in order to become fully self-
sufficient. In this way, we can continue the
war even after the forest people cut off trade.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
That...actually sounds like an okay plan—
certainly good for you folks, at least.
So how can I help?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
WindPriest
Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I'm sure as shoot no farmer,
but I guess visiting places is
just what a Voyager does.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_00.text:
Y'know, when I was told to visit a farm,
I expected to see folk plowing fields,
not building barns. They must be planning
to raise a heck of a lot of critters.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_01.text:
With our wind power, even a small amount of
people can raise a large amount of livestock.
These will be used not only for consumption,
but for trade with other regions as well.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_02.text:
Sounds like a humdinger of a plan
to this guy. So what's the problem?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_03.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_03.text:
Barns are of little use with no livestock to
fill them—but before we can gather our herds
from the pastures, we must deal with the
various fiends in the area.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_04.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_000_04.text:
Okay, maybe not quite as humdinger-y
of a plan as I thought. Thankfully,
I think I can help you folks out.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_010_00.text:
I'm guessing you folks can
take it from there.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_010_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_010_01.text:
Thank you, Voyager! Without your help,
we would be up for a severe tongue-lashing
from our leaders at the temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_302_CUT_010_02.text:
Who the heck are we even
working for here, bud?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Forest Tribe are completely oblivious,
and one small push may be all it takes to
win their surrender. As such, I intend to
attack their lumber mill.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yep. The old 'surprise attack' deal.
That'll shock 'em, all right.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Such an attack is the best way to
minimize damage on both sides,
and therefore the optimal strategy.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Not to be rude there, champ, but I think
not attacking at all is the best way to
minimize damage.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
No one is asking you to participate
in the attack, Soul Voyager!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_303_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_303_CUT_000_00.text:
Well, heck. Wasn't so long ago that the gale
folks and forest folks worked hand-in-hand
to build this lumber mill. Whole deal feels
sorta bleak when you think about it.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_303_CUT_000_01.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_303_CUT_000_01.text:
We worked ourselves near to death in this forest,
yet the Forest Tribe never made any effort to
understand our ways. For us, this place holds
naught but painful memories.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Now we can finally raze this terrible forest!
We will turn it from a terrifying den of beasts
into a peaceful grassland savanna—for one cannot
live on lava and water, nor grow crops there.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
Will there still be wind after you cut
down the forest? You know, delicate
balance of nature and all that?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: WindPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
There will still be trees, Voyager—there is
simply no need for such dense forestland.
All that matters is the wind blowing through
the new grassy plains.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.speaker: UI
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_300_CUT_000_0.text:
You have already acquired
a metal spirit's power.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
How are we to defend ourselves from an assault by
the Gale Tribe? Alas, while we of the Forest Tribe
cannot match their strength, we've no choice but
to throw away our lives in the effort.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Or you could try talking to 'em, maybe?
No reason this has to end in blood.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Yes, we will definitely try that...
and afterward, we will optimize the
lumber mill! That is our only hope.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text: Any way I can help here?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would appreciate you going to the mill,
for I know your presence will bring
great cheer to all the workers.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
I would appreciate you going to the mill,
for I know your presence will bring
great cheer to all the workers.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_00.text:
Golly, look at that crowd of forest
folks around the lumber mill.
The heck are they even doing?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_01.text:
We laid off laborers who will no longer be
needed due to the mill upgrades, and now
they're interfering with the process! We even offered to find them new jobs,
but they refuse to listen.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_02.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_02.text:
We may have to take stronger
measures to remove them.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_03.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_03.text:
Now hold just a second there, guy! Of course
folks are gonna be upset about losing a job,
so let's just maybe work a little harder to
explain why all this is necessary.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_04.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_000_04.text:
Look out! Some of the fiends the
Flamewave League sent are still alive!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_010_00.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_010_00.text:
With the former workers scattered,
we can now upgrade the mill.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_010_01.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_201_CUT_010_01.text: Huh. Were those really leftover fiends from the war with the Flamewave League? I mean, they wouldn't have... Would they?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Our talks with the Gale Tribe did nothing
but heighten suspicions. We should never
have engaged with them at all.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Sorry to hear that, fella, but I still
think that dialogue is the key to—

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
In response, we've formed a cavalry composed
of workers who were made redundant by the mill
upgrade. That should allow us to match the
speed of the gale peoples' forces.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Guess you'll be needing stables
in that case?

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
You guess correctly. As such, we would ask
you to visit the construction site, as we
anticipate interference from the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
We would ask you to visit the construction
site of the stables, as we anticipate
interference from the Gale Tribe.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Cripes, fella. If that's your attitude
toward each other about everything,
it's no wonder talking didn't help.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_000_00.text:
Are the gale folks really planning to sabotage
these stables? Or do you think excessive
precautions like these are the real reason
your peace talks failed, maybe.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_000_01.text:
The wind blows in a strange direction today... 
I wonder if the Gale Tribe is using it
to send some fell beast after us.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_000_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_000_02.text: The heck you talkin' about, guy?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_010_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_010_00.text:
Okay, so are you SURE the gale folks sent
these monsters here? 'Cause they could
have just happened to be flying by.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_010_02.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_202_CUT_010_02.text:
Yeah, I suppose that'd be
one heck of a coincidence.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Gale Tribe derives its strength
from the energy of their wind farm.
Without it, they are powerless.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
Please don't tell me you're gonna
destroy the wind farm.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
The Gale Tribe uses their mastery of the breezes
to send countless fiends after us. We have no
option but to destroy the farm—although I do not
know if we actually possess the power to do so.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
But without that wind energy,
your societies are gonna regress.

SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_FUNC_MIDO_MISSIONCONFIRMATION_TE.text:
That is of no concern. So long as we
have our forests, we can survive.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_203_CUT_000_00.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_203_CUT_000_00.text:
I don't get why they decided to turn on
each other when they all worked so hard
to get this wind farm up and running.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_203_CUT_000_01.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_MISSION_203_CUT_000_01.text:
We will set the wind farm to burn.
If we are slain in the effort,
I leave the fate of the Forest Tribe
in your hands, Voyager. Farewell.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
The strength of the Gale Temple has been
reduced to nothing, and we can now live
lives free of worry. All praise to the forests, for they will
now spread unchecked across all of Cinq,
realizing our dream of a green world!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
A world of trees doesn't sound so bad
to me, though I imagine your neighbors
are gonna feel different.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: WoodsPriest
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
The other peoples do not yet know the worth
of the forest. Once they see how wonderful
it is to make one's home among the canopy
of trees, they will come to see things our way.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.speaker: UI
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_200_CUT_000_0.text:
You have already acquired
a wood spirit's power.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
Well, looks like I'm going home without
any spirit power. The Emerald Wave really
gave me a bum steer here, 'cause I got no
idea where it was trying to send me.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If it is a fire spirit you seek,
return to the Flame Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If it is a water spirit you seek,
return to the Wave Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If it is a wood spirit you seek,
return to the Forest Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If it is a metal spirit you seek,
return to the Gale Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
If it is another spirit you seek,
return to another temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text:
The choice is yours,
Soul Voyager Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_000_0.text: Now hold on just a dang second!

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.text:
You seek a fire spirit, yes? In that case,
you must return to the Flame Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.text:
You seek a water spirit, yes? In that case,
you must return to the Wave Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.text:
You seek a wood spirit, yes? In that case,
you must return to the Forest Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.text:
You seek a metal spirit, yes? In that case,
you must return to the Gale Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_111_CUT_000_0.text:
All will unfold as you so desire it,
Soul Voyager Tsunanori Mido.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_000.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_SPIRIT_000_CUT_000_000.text:
So everything's gonna unfold
just like I want it to, eh?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Well, all the temples are now destroyed,
and I feel like it's pretty much my fault.
Wonder what's gonna happen to this world?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text:
All has been returned to the point from
which it began. The Four Tribes will now
begin anew—and will continue to do so
as many times as it takes.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nitram
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text:
Let's stack these stones
at the Soul Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Atihana
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text:
If we all work together,
we can rebuild the Soul Temple.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Nahoj
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text:
All those of the Four Tribes
possess a soul.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: Irbas
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text: May all our souls be as one.

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_0.text:
You may resume your travels without
worry, Soul Voyager Tsunanori Mido.
Will you take someone with you?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_1.speaker: Tsunanori_Mido
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_110_CUT_010_1.text: Just who the heck ARE you, bud!?

SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_120_CUT_000_0.speaker: SoulSprite
SUB_W07_EVAR_MIDO_GAMEOVER_120_CUT_000_0.text:
Whether or not you can gain the
power of a spirit is up to you now,
Soul Voyager Tsunanori Mido.
